meanings.definition: More severe in degree or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The storm grew severer as the night went on.
meanings.sent2: Her illness took a severer turn, requiring immediate medical attention.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's strictness became even severer when the students wouldn't stop talking.
meanings.sent4: The consequences of his actions were severer than he had anticipated.
meanings.sent5: The severer punishment served as a warning to others.
